trends: There have been 30 other sightings in Lafayette
There were no other sightings in Lafayette on or around March 31st 2011
divs: sighting detailsi was driving south on 18th street in lafayette about two blocks north of jefferson high school. in a brief glance to the east i observed a white star-like object leave a cloud formation and travel for about 3 seconds to another cloud formation and disappear. no tail was observed. the object's size at arm's length was between 1\16 and 1\8th of an inch in diameter. it traveled in a northeastern direction. at the same time there was a single engine prop plane traveling south below the object in question. i estimate the angle observed above the horizon to be approximately 50 degrees. i thought the object could be a meteor, but it did not travel at a steep angle nor did it have a tail or fade gradually. it was one of those experiences that cause you to catch your breath momentarily. intuitively there was something different about the object.
Summary: Observed white star-like object leave a cloud formation to the east and travel a distance in @ 3 sec. to another cloud formation.
